overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a practical approach to time-series forecasting using simple heuristics tailored to short data sequences. It prioritizes daily seasonality capture through hourly averaging, explicitly rejects complex models due to limited data length, and emphasizes step-by-step computation with careful handling of rounding and timestamp generation.
key_insights: Preference for simple methods (hourly averaging) over SARIMA/Exponential Smoothing due to short data history (96 points)
Explicit grouping by hour-of-day indices to capture daily seasonality
Robustness consideration through averaging versus median for outlier handling
Step-by-step timestamp generation for multi-day forecasting
Precision management via rounding to match input data format
complexity_analysis: Moderately detailed with emphasis on heuristic implementation; avoids complex statistical models but includes thorough data grouping, pattern analysis, and computational verification.
